bug.author: akhilesh-k
bug.summary: Git command typo in contributing guidelines wiki
bug.description:
In contributing guidelines git there is a typo in git command. It is : <denchmark-code>git diff -check </denchmark-code>
but it should be: <denchmark-code>git diff --check </denchmark-code>
It is about fixing whitespace error. Check the wiki page <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/wiki/How_to_contribute>here</denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
This can't be fixed because it is already <denchmark-code>git diff --check </denchmark-code>
under <pre> tag. (grab Wiki sources: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv.wiki.git>https://github.com/opencv/opencv.wiki.git</denchmark-link> ) For some reason GitHub shows buggy "long dash symbol" here.
It might be but when one actually copies, single dash symbol gets copied.
Converted the mentioned page to Markdown.

Great. Please look at the Pull Request 10056. It needs to be merged. Please find <denchmark-link:https://github.com/opencv/opencv/pull/10056>here</denchmark-link> <denchmark-link:https://github.com/mshabunin>@mshabunin</denchmark-link>
